title: Analysis of Competitive Performance Behaviors and Strategic Design for Elite Long Jump Athletes

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental sports science theories, basic exercise mechanics, and game analysis methodologies
context.additional_context: Learners must understand advanced theories on elite athletes' performance behavior analysis and strategy design, cultivate application skills through case studies, and demonstrate abilities in actual competition simulation and performance strategy development via project-based assessment

learning_goals: Learners can analyze athletes' performance intentions in competitive environments and design strategic responses for maximum and partial jump scenarios.
Learners can systematically evaluate athletes' self-regulation strategies (emotional/cognitive management) under individual-task-environment constraints.
Learners can design representative learning tasks reflecting real-game contexts (perform, respond, manage) and apply an effectiveness verification process.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
